Posts.Content: Dec 13, 2011 07:15AM MommaG wrote: BlueCowgirl...I almost spit my coffee out my nose because I was laughing so hard at the "up your nose with a rubber hose".  We seriously need that kind of a sense of humour through all this crap! J-Bug...good luck with the PET scan on Monday.  I'm sure everything will be fine!
Posts.Title: Calling All with Tumors 6 cm + J-Bug CaliKelly

Posts.Content: Dec 23, 2011 11:18PM MommaG wrote: Windlass- I am exactly in that scenario right now....my tumour was quite large but the surgeon was happy with the 4mm of clear margins around it.  The part that is not so good is that many of my lymph nodes were also pure cancer.  Had a bone scan yesterday and a CAT scan coming up soon as well.  I hate waiting!!  I just want to know now what's going on.
Posts.Title: Calling All with Tumors 6 cm + J-Bug CaliKelly

Posts.Content: Nov 26, 2011 06:47PM MommaG wrote: Hi!  I'm scheduled for a lateral mastectomy Dec. 2nd....wanted a bilateral but I waited too long to decide.  Now I have to wait to get the other done but that's okay because I'm planning on reconstruction anyhow.  They can just do it all at once then!  One question I have though....what kind of bra would you suggest for after surgery.  I'm quite large (DD) and certainly can't go without a bra for the remaining "girl".  Any other suggestions for post surgery?  I'm sure there's lots I haven't thought of.
Posts.Title: Mastectomy Dec 2011 hawaiik Blessings2011

Posts.Content: Dec 4, 2011 09:34PM MommaG wrote: evebarry- Cookiemonster is right...unilateral mastectomy (not sure what a lateral mastectomy is...I'm gonna blame that on the anesthetic..lol).  I wanted a bilateral and waited too long to decide so it couldn't be done on Friday.  I am planning on having reconstruction done but my onc recommends that I wait for a year because I will be having radiation starting in January.  So I will have the other breast taken when I do the reconstruction.  My reasoning is simply because I don't want to go through this ever again!  Also...I think if I'm going to have one breast reconstructed why not do both so they are relatively similar.  It's totally a personal thing though.  And yes I do have lots of help.  My husband, friends and family have been great!  They took my kids for the whole weekend so I got to have some quiet recovery time when I came home.  They've also been great at bringing us meals and just stopping by for a quick visit.  I'm a very lucky girl! CookieMonster-thanks for the well wishes!  I'm now one step closer to this all being a thing of the past!
Posts.Title: Mastectomy Dec 2011 hawaiik Blessings2011

Posts.Content: Nov 27, 2011 11:23AM MommaG wrote: Goldlining--thanks for the advice!  I think I'm going to try a tank top I have with a "built in bra".  It won't have any support but at least my existing boob won't be hanging past my belly button! haha Whoever invented the built in bra didn't think about us large breasted women!  It's a nice idea but it doesn't look so pretty on me!  I think I'll buy another sports bra as well.....they are always comfy and it'll be nice to have one to wear when the other is being washed.  I have to wait for a year for my reconstruction so I'll definitely be getting fitted for a prosthesis.....especially since my sister is getting married at the end of January.  I'll definitely a foob by then!  Thanks again for the advice.  Gonna get cooking today so I have a few frozen meals for the days following my surgery.
Posts.Title: Mastectomy Dec 2011 hawaiik Blessings2011

Posts.Content: Dec 12, 2011 10:24PM MommaG wrote: My tumour was 14cm by 14cm at my first chemo appt.  I had neoadjuvent chemo 4x AC and then 4x taxol.  Unilateral mastectomy with axillary lymph node dissection on Dec. 2nd.  At my last chemo on Nov.3rd my tumour was 8cm by 7cm but I could tell it had started to grow again before my surgery.  I have also noticed lately that my supraclavicular node feels enlarged.  Waiting to hear back from my onc tomorrow.  My radiation should start in the next couple weeks...hopefully sooner though.  What a journey this is!  It's nice to be able to share it with others who understand what's going on.  Take care of yourselves ladies!  Hugs to all!
Posts.Title: Calling All with Tumors 6 cm + J-Bug CaliKelly

Posts.Content: Dec 4, 2011 09:25AM MommaG wrote: Hello all!  I just had my surgery on Friday....lateral mastectomy with axillary node dissection...and it's not nearly as bad as I was anticipating.  I am a little stiff in my shoulder but otherwise hardly any pain.  The c-section I had with my first child was way worse than this.  I debated not taking my pain meds yesterday but did anyway just in case.  I don't think I'll be taking them today though.  The drain is the worst part about this whole ordeal.  It's really just a pain in the butt to work around!  I'm hoping it won't be in too long but at the same time am not looking forward to having it pulled out...just the thought makes me cringe!
Posts.Title: Mastectomy Dec 2011 hawaiik Blessings2011

Posts.Content: Dec 6, 2011 02:27PM - edited Dec 6, 2011 02:28PM by MommaG Got my drain out today!!!  What a great feeling.  It was kinda weird feeling it being pulled out but what a relief.  Hope everyone else's surgery goes as good as my experience has been.
Posts.Title: Mastectomy Dec 2011 hawaiik Blessings2011
